layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: What I put into my body — food, drink, substances — is ...

answers.4: my choice, though I don't always choose well
answers.2: hard to control given my schedule and circumstances
answers.3: partly my choice, partly what's practical
answers.1: mostly determined by what's available or affordable

answers.4: mine to protect, though I don't always succeed
answers.2: hard to protect given everything I'm juggling
answers.3: something I try to prioritize, but life often wins
answers.1: at the mercy of my schedule and demands

questions.text: When my nutrition or sleep suffers, it's because ...

answers.4: I'm not prioritizing it, though the constraints are real
answers.2: work and family take priority — there's only so much time
answers.3: life is demanding, but I could make better choices
answers.1: my schedule and demands leave no room

questions.text: My physical environment — clean space, organization, toxins — is ...
questions.principle: Clean your room; own your space

answers.4: mine to shape, though I let it slide sometimes
answers.2: hard to manage with everything else going on
answers.3: partly my responsibility, partly limited by circumstances
answers.1: out of my control given my living situation

questions.text: Creating conditions for my body to recover and thrive is ...

answers.4: my responsibility, though I often just cope
answers.2: hard — I'm mostly coping with chronic depletion
answers.3: something I try, but chronic depletion is real
answers.1: a luxury — I'm just managing depletion
